subject: Re: [junit] JUnit Testing Code That Has System.exit(n);
msgSnippet: ... The problem here is not at all the java.lang.System API. It s the inappropriate use of System.exit() in the client code. -- ﻿Elliotte Rusty Harold
messageBody:
Michael Feathers wrote:
> Elliotte Harold wrote:
>
>> Why not install a SecurityManager that blocks calls to System.exit() by
>> throwing a SecurityException, which you then catch? A littl ehackisjh
>> but it should work.
>>
>>
>>
>
> And it's a shame that we have to do hackish things to test code that
> uses vendor supplied APIs, isn't it?
>

The problem here is not at all the java.lang.System API. It's the
inappropriate use of System.exit() in the client code.

--
